body_html: The easiest way to prefetch data is to use dataset = dataset.prefetch(BUFFER_SIZE), which is available in the nightly build. If you're using a release, you can get the same effect with dataset = dataset.map(lambda x, y, z, ...: return (x, y, z, ...), num_threads=1, output_buffer_size=BUFFER_SIZE).
body_text: The easiest way to prefetch data is to use dataset = dataset.prefetch(BUFFER_SIZE), which is available in the nightly build. If you're using a release, you can get the same effect with dataset = dataset.map(lambda x, y, z, ...: return (x, y, z, ...), num_threads=1, output_buffer_size=BUFFER_SIZE).
body: The easiest way to prefetch data is to use [`dataset = dataset.prefetch(BUFFER_SIZE)`](https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/api_docs/python/tf/contrib/data/Dataset#prefetch), which is available in the nightly build. If you're using a release, you can get the same effect with `dataset = dataset.map(lambda x, y, z, ...: return (x, y, z, ...), num_threads=1, output_buffer_size=BUFFER_SIZE)`.
